radiographic_examinations.findings: Lower chest mild dependent and subsegmental atelectasis, right greater than left; no focal consolidations or pleural/pericardial effusion. Liver, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, urinary bladder, and reproductive organs normal. Extensive fat stranding and fluid in the right lower quadrant with dilated appendix with hyperemic walls, appendicolith at the base, wall disruption, and development of fluid collection. Mild circumferential wall thickening of the distal esophageal wall may be due to esophagitis. No evidence of distant pneumoperitoneum. No bowel obstruction. Small fat containing umbilical hernia and left inguinal hernia.
